alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 8:38PM PST until January 04 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Polk and Benton Counties. Pudding River at Aurora affecting Clackamas and Marion Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...Until later tonight. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely, especially if the Willamette is running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:31 PM PST Tuesday the stage was near 27.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage later tonight. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
